alert.note: Alert for Butler; Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 6:50AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler, Hamilton and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 AM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain had fallen due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dayton, Kettering, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Forest Park, Springboro, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Wyoming and Bellbrook.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
